availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Executive Journal, 1859-1862

body.p:
20
The Governor approved an account of $25. to Thomas Hobsen Jailer of Nashville his fees for keeping one Jno. Luster a Fugitive from Justice which was omitted by the Agent making the demand for the fugitive.
He appointed H. W. McKinley and Thos D. Wright Aids with the rank of Colonel
He accepted and caused to be filed the resignation of G. J. Bileford a Justice of the Peace for Fulton county in District No 1.
He appointed the following Justices in the counties named, to wit:

row.cell: Jno C. Scifres vice J. M. Nickolls

body.p: He appointed Jno. A. Staley Comr of Deeds for Georgia (Savannah)
He approved and signed enrolled bill Chapter 176.
